clinical_study.brief_title: Predicting the Outcome of Total Knee Arthroplasty and Spinal Surgeon
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study of Risk Factors and Outcomes Following Total Knee Arthroplasty and Spinal Surgeon

collaborator.agency: No.1 Hospital affiliated to General Hospital of the Chinese People's Liberation Army

oversight_info.authority: China: Beijing Municipal Science and Technology Commission

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to investigate the preoperative and operative factor of pain and functional outcome at one years following total knee arthroplasty and spinal surgeon.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Change of functional score over time in the patients after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of quality of life score over time in the patients after operation

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples collected from Peripheral Venous Bloodï¼› Tissues collected from the operation

study_pop.textblock: Inpatients; Patients have been diagnosed with osteoarthritis or disc degeneration disease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The patients have been waiting for surgery for treatment of osteoarthritis or disc degeneration disease.
2. Must be between 18 and 65 years of age, of either sex.
3. Must demonstrate willingness to participate in the study by signing the written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with Mandatory spondylitis, infections, neoplasms, inflammation, deformities, or previous surgery of spine or knee.
2. The patient is participating in an interventional clinical trial or has in an interventional clinical trial within 30 days prior to enrollment.
